text: Heat index values up to 109 are possible in Central & North Texas. A Heat Advisory is in effect for Milam County through 8 pm Friday. AUSTIN, TX â€” An Austin Independent School District (AISD) music teacher has been arrested for indecency with a child by exposure and improper relationship with a student. Austin ISD police officers arrested LBJ Early College High School teacher Rodney Childers on Wednesday, July 31 on a charge of two counts of Indecency with a child by exposure, a second-degree felony, and two counts of improper educator/student relationship, a second-degree felony. According to a letter sent to families from Dr. Angel Wilson, Assistant Superintendent of Secondary Schools at Austin ISD, Childers has taught band, piano, and choir at LBJ since August 2023. [ALSO| U.S. Marshals arrest Hutto man wanted for indecency with a child by exposure](https://cbsaustin.com/news/local/us-marshals-arrest-hutto-man-wanted-for-indecency-with-a-child-by-exposure) The allegation was first reported by a parent on Thursday, July 25. Childers was immediately placed on administrative leave while Austin ISD Police conducted their investigation. School officials say to protect the privacy of the student and family involved, they cannot disclose details on the allegations and arrest. "The safety of our students is our greatest concern. We are doing everything we can to understand how this incident occurred to prevent situations like this in the future," the letter said. Austin ISD officials ask anyone who believes they have information related to the investigation to contact Austin ISD Police at 512-414-1703. This is an ongoing investigation.
